1.description: The New Conglomerate's Mag-Cutter features a powerful electromagnet capable of cutting through enemy body armor.
1.name: Mag-Cutter

100.description: This single-use Medical Kit instantly restores 500 health via needle-free, subcutaneous delivery of adrenaline and nanite-based coagulants.
100.name: Medical Kit

101.description: This single-use Medical Kit instantly restores 500 health via needle-free, subcutaneous delivery of adrenaline and nanite-based coagulants.
101.name: Medical Kit

1044.description: A New Conglomerate anti-personnel Bouncing Betty that detonates upon detecting nearby enemy movement.
1044.name: Bouncing Betty

1045.description: A Vanu Sovereignty anti-personnel Proximity Mine that detonates upon detecting nearby enemy movement.
1045.name: Proximity Mine

1082.description: Powered exosuits swinging heavy MAX weaponry have proven to have devastating effects on soldiers unfortunate enough to get in the way.
1082.name: MAX Punch

1083.description: Powered exosuits swinging heavy MAX weaponry have proven to have devastating effects on soldiers unfortunate enough to get in the way.
1083.name: MAX Punch

1084.description: Powered exosuits swinging heavy MAX weaponry have proven to have devastating effects on soldiers unfortunate enough to get in the way.
1084.name: MAX Punch

1095.description:
Anti-Vehicle Grenades can stick to and damage vehicles and MAX units, but are less harmful to standard infantry.

3 second fuse.
1095.name: Anti-Vehicle Grenade

1096.description:
The Concussion Grenade disorients targets in the blast area, temporarily blurring their vision and hindering motor control.

3 second fuse.
1096.name: Concussion Grenade

1097.description: Nanite Systems' first attempts into close-range weaponry resulted in the powerful Baron G5. The tube fed Baron is able to put down targets at longer ranges than typical shotguns thanks to its narrow choke.
1097.name: NS Baron G5B

The Nano-Armor Kit repairs friendly vehicles, MAXes, equipment and can deconstruct enemy tank mines.

Hold Fire to repair and Aim to deconstruct.

128.description: The semi-automatic Mauler S6's overclocked propulsion coils and tighter spread make it a versatile close-range weapon. NC use only.
128.name: Mauler S6

129.description: Manufactured with an energy-efficient discharge coil, the high capacity Nova is capable of extended fire before needing to change power cores. VS use only.
129.name: Nova

13.description: The Chainblade knife's razor sharp teeth have proven extremely effective in close quarters combat.
13.name: Chainblade

14.description: The standard assault rifle of the Terran Republic, the T1 Cycler features a 40-round magazine and a fast rate of fire, allowing it to remain effective in most situations. TR use only.
14.name: T1 Cycler

15.description: The reliable TX1 Repeater is the latest iteration of a firearm design stretching back 300 years. Its 3-round burst fire mode provides considerable stopping power at close range. TR use only.
15.name: TX1 Repeater

15000.description: Originally developed as a stationary turret, the MAX-mounted, multi-barreled M1 Heavy Cycler is capable of shredding apart entire squads without needing to reload. TR use only.
15000.name: M1 Heavy Cycler

15001.description: The M3 Pounder fires High Explosive Grenade rounds that have a devastating effect on enemy armor. TR use only.
15001.name: M3 Pounder HEG

15004.description: The anti-air NS-10 Burster uses Smart Unguided Projectiles to explode in the presence of ferrous material at high speeds. TR use only.
15004.name: NS-10 Burster

15012.description: Originally developed as a stationary turret, the MAX-mounted, multi-barreled M1 Heavy Cycler is capable of shredding apart entire squads without needing to reload. TR use only.
15012.name: M1 Heavy Cycler

15013.description: The M3 Pounder fires High Explosive Grenade rounds that have a devastating effect on enemy armor. TR use only.
15013.name: M3 Pounder HEG

15016.description: The anti-air NS-10 Burster uses Smart Unguided Projectiles to explode in the presence of ferrous material at high speeds. TR use only.
15016.name: NS-10 Burster

15024.description: The M6 Onslaught was designed as a defensive alternative to the MX1, allowing for a higher rate of fire suitable for holding down important locations. TR use only.
15024.name: M6 Onslaught

15025.description: The M2's increased ammo capacity has proven itself as a boon to small or stranded squads. TR use only.
15025.name: M2 Mutilator

15030.description: Ironically nicknamed "Mercy," the latest iteration of the accurate Mobile Rotary Cannon can drop enemy infantry at a distance. TR use only.
15030.name: MRC3 Mercy

153.description: A deployable ammunition pack that replenishes the ammo supplies of nearby soldiers
153.name: Ammunition Package 1

154.description:
Creates a nanite field that regenerates shields in a 6 meter radius. Each cert rank increases the regeneration rate.

Using Ablity will equip the deployable.
154.name: Shield Recharging Field

16000.description: The arm-mounted NCM1 Scattercannon functions as an automatic shotgun capable of cutting through enemy squads. NC use only.
16000.name: NCM1 Scattercannon

16001.description: The NCM2 Falcon is the standard for the NC's anti-vehicle MAX weaponry. It features powerful warheads capable of heavily damaging enemy vehicles and MAXes alike. NC use only.
16001.name: NCM2 Falcon

16004.description: The anti-air NS-10 Burster uses Smart Unguided Projectiles to explode in the presence of ferrous material at high speeds. NC use only.
16004.name: NS-10 Burster

16012.name: NCM1 Scattercannon

16016.name: NS-10 Burster

16024.description: The AF-34 Mattock features increased effective range in comparison to the other MAX anti-infantry weapons. NC use only.
16024.name: AF-34 Mattock

16025.description: Known for its lethality in close quarters, the automatic AF-41 Hacksaw's high rate of fire gives it an advantage for point defense scenarios. NC use only.
16025.name: AF-41 Hacksaw

16026.description: Auraxis Firearms' first venture into MAX weaponry was the AF-23 Grinder. It features an extended ammo reserve for sustained fire. NC use only.
16026.name: AF-23 Grinder

16028.description: The left handed  NCM3 Raven is a laser guided rocket launcher that deals heavy damage to vehicles. NC use only.
16028.name: NCM3 Raven

16029.description: The right handed NCM3 Raven is a laser guided rocket launcher that deals heavy damage to vehicles. NC use only.
16029.name: NCM3 Raven

16030.description: The MR1 Fracture is a dual rotary cannon that fires self-propelled, high velocity rockets designed specifically to penetrate vehicle armor. TR use only.
16030.name: MR1 Fracture

16031.description: The MR1 Fracture is a dual rotary cannon that fires self-propelled, high velocity rockets designed specifically to penetrate vehicle armor. TR use only.
16031.name: MR1 Fracture

16032.description: The Vortex VM21 fires a charged particle beam that punches through vehicle armor with incredible accuracy and speed. Holding down fire will accumulate charges, dealing more damage while consuming more ammo. VS use only.
16032.name: Vortex VM21

16033.description: The Vortex VM21 fires a charged particle beam that punches through vehicle armor with incredible accuracy and speed. Holding down fire will accumulate charges, dealing more damage while consuming more ammo. VS use only.
16033.name: Vortex VM21

17000.description: The heavy Quasar VM1 was one of the earliest weapons created with discovered Vanu technology. The rapid firing plasma cannon can tear apart enemy foot soldiers with ease. VS use only.
17000.name: Quasar VM1

17001.description: The Comet VM2 is the standard-issue anti-vehicle MAX weaponry. The explosive plasma orbs it fires are capable of melting through heavy tank armor. VS use only.
17001.name: Comet VM2

17004.description: The anti-air NS-10 Burster uses Smart Unguided Projectiles to explode in the presence of ferrous material at high speeds. VS use only.
17004.name: NS-10 Burster

17012.description: The heavy Quasar VM1 was one of the earliest weapons created with discovered Vanu technology. The rapid firing plasma cannon can tear apart enemy foot soldiers with ease. VS use only.
17012.name: Quasar VM1

17013.description: The Comet VM2 is the standard-issue anti-vehicle MAX weaponry. The explosive plasma orbs it fires are capable of melting through heavy tank armor. VS use only.
17013.name: Comet VM2

17016.description: The anti-air NS-10 Burster uses Smart Unguided Projectiles to explode in the presence of ferrous material at high speeds. VS use only.
17016.name: NS-10 Burster

17024.description: The Nebula VM20's overclocked power core interface allows for a rapid rate of fire to quickly dispatch enemy infantry in close quarters. VS use only.
17024.name: Nebula VM20

17025.description: A late successor to the Quasar VM1, the Cosmos uses experimental plasma containment technology, resulting in larger rounds. These large plasma rounds cause less cranial trauma, but are significantly easier to strike mobile targets with. VS use only.
17025.name: Cosmos VM3

17030.description: The lightweight Blueshift VM5 anti-infantry MAX weapon was designed to provide increased accuracy over the standard-issue VM1. VS use only.
17030.name: Blueshift VM5

1849.description: Nanite Systems' first attempts into close-range weaponry resulted in the powerful Baron G5. The tube fed Baron is able to put down targets at longer ranges than typical shotguns thanks to its narrow choke.
1849.name: NS Baron G5G

1869.description: Auraxis Firearms launched the Fortuna Mercenary for the discerning soldier of fortune that prefers close-quarters combat without having to give up their shotgun.
1869.name: 19A Fortuna

1879.description: Co-developed with Genudine's Offense Development team, the NC6A GODSAW incorporates an alternate firing mode which allows the weapon to pierce heavy armor in exchange for reduced infantry damage.
1879.name: NC6A GODSAW

1884.description: Exemplary of NC ingenuity and their utter disdain for rules, the aftermarket parts welded into the Brawler not only make it more accurate than typical shotguns, but also illegal to possess in the Terran Republic. Not that they care.
1884.name: The Brawler

1889.description: The Auraxium variant of the NC4, The Executive is typically only issued to the enigmatic members of The Board, the New Conglomerate's governing body. It features a unique low-velocity suppressor that doesn't affect stopping power at range.
1889.name: The Executive

1894.description: Orion's largest star also shines brightly as a powerful, accurate LMG capable of sustained suppressing fire. Plagued by multiple redesigns during its troubled development, the third and final iteration proved itself as a favorite amongst the VS.
1894.name: Betelgeuse 54-A

1899.description: Custom-built for Sigma Squad's infamous Hossin Rebirth mission, the unique Tempest SMG performs similar as a carbine at long distances.
1899.name: Tempest

19.description: The Vanu Sovereignty's Force Blade emits highly charged particles from its cutting edge which are extremely destructive to organic tissue.
19.name: Force-Blade

19000.description: Very few weapons are able to touch the Lynx's incredible rate of fire. Featuring a cyclic rate of 909 RPM, the LC2 Lynx tears through infantry at close to medium range.
19000.name: LC2 Lynx

1904.description: The TR released the Unity to commemorate the time-tested Cycler assault rifle, a key weapon attributed to helping bring Earth together under the Terran Republic's harmonious rule.
1904.name: T1A Unity

1909.description: Built off of the Pulsar assault rifle, the long-range Darkstar was named after the notorious squad of designated marksman medics that popularized its use.
1909.name: Darkstar

1914.description: Though not officially sanctioned for use on the field, the TR has turned a blind eye to the use of the TRAC-Shot. Bolted together by TR mechanics in their downtime, the TRAC-Shot's multiple rail attachments are unconventional but effective.
1914.name: TRAC-Shot

1919.description: The Eclipse easily overshadows its predecessor, the Solstice, as a close-quarters combat king. It comes equipped with an underbarrel plasma shotgun for ambushes and last-ditch scenarios.
1919.name: Eclipse VE3A

1924.description: The Butcher gained its reputation as a fearsome weapon capable of unending, long-range suppressive fire following a series of extended engagements at The Crown. Built on the CARV platform, the Butcher's notoriety has been earned over time in blood.
1924.name: T9A "Butcher"

1934.description: The TR's infamous Havoc Squad popularized this shotgun loadout enough to have it put into production. Primarily used with behind-the-lines galaxy drops to secure CCs, the Havoc can clear rooms and hold points with the best of them.
1934.name: Havoc

1939.description: Named for the pandemonium this highly modified plasma-core shotgun can cause in a surprise ambush, the Chaos' reputation as a very deadly flanking weapon has been well earned.
1939.name: Chaos

1944.description: Designed for use by the Terran Republic's top Infiltrator hit squads, the Shuriken's incredible flexibility both close-up and at a distance allowed TR assassins to deal with a multitude of situations they may've not survived otherwise.
1944.name: Shuriken

1949.description: The Skorpios was created as an outdoor SMG to bolster the survivability of the Vanu Sovereignty's frightening Wraith squads when their cloaked Flashes were past running condition.
1949.name: Skorpios

1954.description: This Auraxium-clad variant of the TX1 Repeater is a replica of former Terran Republic President Connery's weapon of choice. Equipped with a special suppressor, this silenced pistol remains effective even at longer ranges.
1954.name: The President

1959.description: Commissioned by the undying founder of the Vanu Sovereignty for use as his own personal sidearm, Briggs' variant of the Beamer, The Immortal, features an integrated suppressor that retains stopping power even at a distance.
1959.name: The Immortal

1964.description: Nanite Systems' mightiest anti-tank weapon received a facelift with the release of The Kraken, a commemorative Auraxium-plated Decimator. Its powerful warheads create a miniaturized singularity upon impact.
1964.name: The Kraken

1969.description: An experimental prototype based off the EM4 resulted in the Moonshot, a hyper-long range bolt-action sniper rifle. While stealth is not the Moonshot's specialty, the speed at which it can drop even the farthest targets offsets its drawbacks.
1969.name: The Moonshot

1974.description: The TRs' Bighorn .50M surpassed the RAMS as the heaviest sniper rifle in their arsenal. Boasting an unmatched bullet velocity and a straight-pull bolt for rapid shots, the deafening crack of the Bighorn is a warning to distant soldiers.
1974.name: Bighorn .50M

1979.description: Built from a highly-tinkered Parallax, the Parsec was the brainchild of a small group of engineers looking for long-range perfection. Though significantly louder than most sniper rifles, it drops targets before the sound wave even reaches them.
1979.name: Parsec VX3-A

1984.description: Genudine's heavily modified Guardian rifle was initially designed for long-range support for Heavy Assault soldiers ambushing from on high or in cover. Deadly from even long distances, the accurate Guardian can drop targets from afar with ammo to spare.
1984.name: GD Guardian

1989.description: Though currently not in production, the Terran Republic's powerful DMR-99 has a dedicated following of designated marksmen that stick by their tried-and-true battle rifle, rather than switch to a newer model.
1989.name: DMR-99

1994.description: A favorite of Vanu anti-vehicle support soldiers, the unique Revenant battle rifle is excellent at dropping enemies that have bailed to escape their doomed vehicle following a coordinated Lancer strike.
1994.name: Revenant

2.description: The versatile standard-issue NC4 Mag-Shot was the first pistol to utilize Gauss technology. NC use only.
2.name: NC4 Mag-Shot

20.description: The Pulsar VS1 is the standard issue assault rifle for the Vanu Sovereignty. Its low recoil design allows it to remain effective in most situations. VS use only.
20.name: Pulsar VS1

200.description: Allows the engineer to construct a MANA anti-infantry machine gun turret. It is equipped with a projectile shield that protects the operator from forward facing threats.
200.name: Anti-Infantry MANA Turret

20000.description: The VX6-7's fast rate of fire and lightweight construction make it an excellent weapon in close quarters combat. VS use only.
20000.name: VX6-7

2001.description: The awe-inspiring stopping power of the accurate NS-44 Commissioner revolver can put down even mid-range targets with a few well-placed shots. All factions can use this weapon.
2001.name: NS-44P Commissioner

201.description: Allows the engineer to construct a MANA anti-infantry machine gun turret. It is equipped with a projectile shield that protects the operator from forward facing threats.
201.name: Anti-Infantry MANA Turret

202.description: Allows the engineer to construct a MANA anti-infantry machine gun turret. It is equipped with a projectile shield that protects the operator from forward facing threats.
202.name: Anti-Infantry MANA Turret

21.description: The Beamer VS3 is the standard sidearm for the Vanu Sovereignty. Its high rate of fire allows the user to eliminate nearby targets quickly. VS use only.
21.name: Beamer VS3

2308.description: The powerful Hunter QCX Quad-Cam crossbow is a lightweight sidearm, capable of silently taking out targets up to medium range with deadly precise bolts.
2308.name: Hunter QCX

2309.description: The powerful Heartstring Quad-Cam crossbow is a lightweight sidearm, capable of silently taking out targets up to medium range with deadly precise bolts.
2309.name: Heartstring

2310.description: The powerful Blackheart Quad-Cam crossbow is a lightweight sidearm, capable of silently taking out targets up to medium range with deadly precise bolts.
2310.name: Blackheart

2311.description: Thanks to its lightweight frame and stabilized barrel, the NS-30 Vandal scout rifle features accurate fire and superior mobility while aimed, making it a common choice for aggressive, mid-range infiltration.
2311.name: NS-30 Vandal

2312.description: Thanks to its lightweight frame and stabilized barrel, the NS-30 Vandal scout rifle features accurate fire and superior mobility while aimed, making it a common choice for aggressive, mid-range infiltration.
2312.name: NS-30B Vandal

2313.description: Thanks to its lightweight frame and stabilized barrel, the NS-30 Vandal scout rifle features accurate fire and superior mobility while aimed, making it a common choice for aggressive, mid-range infiltration.
2313.name: NS-30G Vandal

2314.description: The MKV has an integrated suppressor that prevents the user from showing on the minimap when firing. It features superior bullet velocity and long range stopping power compared to SMGs using optional aftermarket suppressors.
2314.name: MKV Suppressed

2315.description: The MKV has an integrated suppressor that prevents the user from showing on the minimap when firing. It features superior bullet velocity and long range stopping power compared to SMGs using optional aftermarket suppressors.
2315.name: MKV-B Suppressed

2316.description: The MKV has an integrated suppressor that prevents the user from showing on the minimap when firing. It features superior bullet velocity and long range stopping power compared to SMGs using optional aftermarket suppressors.
2316.name: MKV-G Suppressed

2317.description: The powerful Hunter QCX Quad-Cam crossbow is a lightweight sidearm, capable of silently taking out targets up to medium range with deadly precise bolts.
2317.name: Hunter QCX-B

2318.description: The powerful Hunter QCX Quad-Cam crossbow is a lightweight sidearm, capable of silently taking out targets up to medium range with deadly precise bolts.
2318.name: Hunter QCX-G

24000.description: The semi-automatic Special Purpose Rifle (SPR) is a marksman rifle built on the highly-configurable Gauss platform. Developed after the start of the Auraxis War, it has remained in use due to its accuracy when making long-distance shots. NC use only.
24000.name: Gauss SPR

24001.description: The medium-range SAS-R's sniper rifle features a rapid bolt action that allows users to make follow up shots on targets before they can reach cover. NC use only.
24001.name: SAS-R

24002.description: The semi-automatic Impetus sniper rifle is a favorite amongst Infiltrators for covert operations. It excels at medium range due to its considerable stopping power and rate of fire. NC use only.
24002.name: Impetus

24003.description: The high muzzle velocity of the LA80's projectiles reduces the amount that a target must be lead, making it an excellent choice for sniping targets at extreme distances. NC use only.
24003.name: LA80

24004.description: The bulky EM4 Longshot's overclocked propulsion coils allow for projectiles that both travel faster and hit harder in comparison to other bolt-action sniper rifles. NC use only.
24004.name: EM4 Longshot

24007.description: The AF-6 Shadow is a semi-automatic scout rifle purpose-built for closer effective ranges than sniper rifles. NC use only.
24007.name: AF-6 Shadow

24008.description: The accurate Warden semi-automatic battle rifle is effective at stopping infantry far past the typical LMG or carbine. NC use only.
24008.name: Warden

2500.description: The M12 Kobalt is a 50 cal machine gun that is effective against infantry targets. All factions can use this weapon.
2500.name: M12 Kobalt-F

25000.description: The versatile M77-B's balance of stopping power, accuracy, and rate of fire make it an excellent choice for Infiltrators that have been provided with limited information for a mission. TR use only.
25000.name: M77-B

25001.description: Deadly in the hands of a skilled Infiltrator, the bolt action TSAR-42's features a unique bolt rotation system designed to improve the time between shots. TR use only.
25001.name: TSAR-42

25002.description: The KSR-35's high-powered 7x65 cartridge is extremely effective at dropping targets at medium range. TR use only.
25002.name: KSR-35

25003.description: The powerful bolt-action SR-7 is capable of eliminating targets from extremely long distances. TR use only.
25003.name: SR-7

25004.description: Chambered for the powerful 12.7x75mm round, the high muzzle velocity and stopping power afforded by the RAMS .50M ensures shots will hit harder and faster than others in its class. TR use only.
25004.name: RAMS .50M

25007.description: The accurate Heavy Scout Rifle features a higher rate of fire compared to semi-auto sniper rifles. TR use only.
25007.name: HSR-1

25008.description: The semi-automatic AMR-66 battle rifle uses powerful cartridges that hold considerable stopping power up to medium range. TR use only.
25008.name: AMR-66

6002637.description: This custom-painted variant of the magazine-fed NS-R3 Swarm can switch between low velocity and high velocity rockets which lock onto both ground and air targets, allowing the user to tailor the weapon's tracking capabilities based on the engagement. <font color="#dc9c36">Flak detonation. Required Lockon: Aircraft or Armor</font>

6002640.description: The fully automatic NS-61 Emissary operates comfortably at mid-range, thanks to its accuracy and large magazine. All factions can use this weapon.

6002661.description: With an extended barrel and integrated scope the NS-44L Blackhand provides significant advantages over similar pistols when engaging threats at longer ranges.

6002745.description: This 4th Anniversary Edition of the RAMS .50 harnesses high muzzle velocity and stopping power to hit harder and faster than other sniper rifles in its class. TR use only.

6002896.description: This 4th Anniversary Edition of the compact GR-22 has improved handling when firing on the move, making it an excellent choice for close quarters combat. NC use only.

6003599.description: The right-handed NS-20 Gorgon is a slow firing, heavy machine gun effective at eliminating armored targets, and can challenge close-range infantry as well. This variant features classy flames over a black finish. All factions can use NS weapons.
6003599.name: NS-20 "Heatwave" Gorgon

6003600.description: The left-handed NS-20 Gorgon is a slow firing, heavy machine gun effective at eliminating armored targets, and can challenge close-range infantry as well. This variant features classy flames over a black finish. All factions can use NS weapons.

6003704.name: NS-45 "Brass" Pilot

6003738.description:
When detonated, the grenade creates a field that repairs nearby mechanical targets for 50 health per second. This grenade sticks to vehicles and MAX units, and cannot repair generators.

Lasts for 10 seconds.
6003738.name: Nano-Repair Grenade

6003752.description: This platinum variant of the NSX Tanto is a powerful, lightweight carbine which combines precision with versatility, and is most effective in short bursts. All factions can use NS weapons.

6003879.description: The adaptable Jackal SMG has high stopping power in close quarters while remaining easy to control. TR use only.
6003879.name: MG-S1 Jackal

6003925.description: Advances in plasma manipulation technology have resulted in the VE-S Canis, a compact, close range weapon with a firing rate that increases over time. VS use only.

6003943.description: Reminescent of old-world deringer designs, this modified Underboss fires two rounds at once.

6003967.description: Vanu Labs' close-to-midrange Zenith VX-5 uses advanced crystalline structures to significantly reduce weight without compromising on strength. It features both precision hipfire and increased movement speed while aiming.
6003967.name: Zenith VX-5AE

6003968.description: Very few weapons are able to touch the Lynx's incredible rate of fire. Featuring a cyclic rate of 909 RPM, the LC2 Lynx tears through infantry at close to medium range.

6004008.description: The automatic AF-18 Stalker is deadly in close quarters and medium range combat. NC use only.

6004009.description: The automatic SOAS-20's high rate of fire makes it an excellent choice for mid-range encounters. TR use only.

6004010.description: The fully automatic Artemis VX26 scout rifle is capable of quickly dispatching enemy infantry at close to medium ranges. VS use only.
6004010.name: Artemis VX26 AE

6004118.description: Advanced cooling techniques provide the Maw LMG with a decisive mix of reload speed and stopping power, offering flexibility in many combat scenarios. VS use only.

6004120.description: Equipped with a state of the art cooling jacket, the Watchman LMG boasts the highest rate of fire of any weapon in its class. TR use only.
6004120.name: MG-H1 Watchman

6004144.description: The experimental Lasher X2 fires volatile orbs of plasma that explode on contact with hard surfaces. Field trials have demonstrated its effectiveness at suppressing fire, flushing out enemies and melting infantry. VS use only.
6004144.name: Lasher X2-P

6004168.description: The sound of the menacing T7 MCG firing strikes fear into the heart of its enemies. It is capable of sustained fire that can tear apart entire squads. TR use only.

6004174.description: The NC05 Jackhammer's stopping power and sustained fire capabilities make it a frightening weapon in close quarters combat. It features a unique burst fire mode that doubles its rate of fire. NC use only.

6004197.description: The Naginata light machine gun can maintain rounds on medium ranged targets without releasing the trigger, but quickly loses that benefit while moving. All factions can use NS weapons.

6004198.description: This exceptional weapon will be unveiled at a later date.

6004201.description:
Deploys a dependable Snowman to stand watch over your base.

Only available during Auraximas.
6004201.name: Tactical Snowman

6004209.description: The Bishop marksman rifle uses signature ammunition coupled with advanced charge coils to pierce through multiple targets in a single shot. In addition, its heavy damage and controllability make it ideal for long-range engagements. NC use only.

6004216.description: The Dragoon is a heavy battle rifle with automatic firing capabilities that hits hard at any range. TR use only.

Originally pitched as a research tool to measure Anomaly variance, the Ectoblaster releases a barrage of plasma before overheating. Users are cautioned not to cross the streams.

3 second fuse.

6005332.description: Advanced cooling techniques provide the Maw LMG with a decisive mix of reload speed and stopping power, offering flexibility in many combat scenarios. VS use only.

6005544.description: Pummeler Rocket Pods are equipped with small, anti-vehicle rockets that are fired from fixed-wing mounts, resulting an accurate volley with minimal deviation.

6005622.description: Allows cortium to be used to construct an Aspis Anti-Aircraft Phalanx Tower that may be manned by allied players.
6005622.name: Hoplon Anti-Aircraft Phalanx Tower

6005624.description: Construct a Xiphos Anti-Personnel Phalanx Tower that may be manned by allied players.
6005624.name: Xiphos Anti-Personnel Tower

6005626.description: The Light Air Terminal can be used to spawn light aircraft such as ESFs and Valkyries at the cost of Cortium.
6005626.name: Light Air Terminal

6005628.description: Alerts the owner and their squad when an enemy is detected or a construct is attacked within 100 meters of the alarm module. Will automatically deconstruct if owner is offline for more than 2 minutes.
6005628.name: Alarm Module

6005630.description: Allows cortium to be used to create a module that, when powered, can resupply the ammunition of ground vehicles in its vicinity.
6005630.name: Vehicle Ammo Dispenser

6005632.description: The Flail fires a volley of 4 mortar shells in quick succession, doing moderate damage to all in range. Requires AI module as well as a manually fired targeting dart in order to fire.
6005632.name: The Flail

6005634.description: Large wall that once fully constructed can withstand a moderate amount of damage.
6005634.name: Blast Wall

6005636.description: The Glaive Ionized Particle Cannon is unmanned mid-range artillery that disrupts defensive shield systems but only inflicts minor damage to personnel and equipment due to its lack of conventional payload. The IPC requires AI module support as well as a manually fired targeting dart to acquire a target.
6005636.name: Glaive IPC

6005638.description: Allows cortium to be used to construct a Spear Anti-Vehicle Phalanx Tower that may be manned by allied players. This object shares it's maximum in world limit with another construction item(s).
6005638.name: Spear Anti-Vehicle Tower

6005640.description: Allows cortium to be used to create a banner displaying your faction logo.
6005640.name: Faction Banner

6005642.description: Vehicle Gates are large walls with an opening wide enough for vehicles to pass through; when combined with a Structure Shield Module the opening will be sealed with an energy shield that will block enemy vehicles and large projectiles.
6005642.name: Vehicle Gate

6005644.description: Allows cortium to be used to create a tower structure that can be used by infantry units.
6005644.name: Infantry Tower

6005646.description: Constructs a large, fortified lumifiber trimed wall with firing areas for infantry. This object shares it's maximum in world limit with at least one other construction item.
6005646.name: Lumifiber Rampart Wall

6005648.description: This uplink structure can unleash a devastating attack from orbit. When powered and charged, any target in range can be designated using a tool obtained from the uplink terminal. Longer distance strikes cost additional charge, so frequent or long distance attacks will require longer term defense of the structure.
6005648.name: Orbital Strike Uplink

6005650.description: Allows cortium to be used to construct a Spear Anti-Vehicle Phalanx Turret that may be manned by allied players. This object shares it's maximum in world limit with another construction item(s).
6005650.name: Spear Anti-Vehicle Turret

6005652.description: Small fortified structure that can provide cover for both infantry and deployed equipment.
6005652.name: Pillbox

6005654.description: Allows deployed Sunderers within range of it to be a potential continent wide reinforcements needed spawnpoint; your faction population in the area must still meet the reinforcement needed requirements.
6005654.name: Reinforcements Module

6005655.description: When placed, the Router becomes a spawn point for allies.
6005655.name: Router

6005657.description: Silos hold up to 50,000 Cortium and are required to power modules and other core structures. ANTs are required to deposit additional Cortium into a Silo.
6005657.name: Cortium Silo

6005659.description: When powered by an adjacent silo the Elysium Spawn Tube will provide a spawn point for nearby allies at the cost of a small amount of Cortium each spawn. Additionally, it includes a binding option, allowing those linked to it to spawn at it from anywhere on the continent. You can only bind to one point at a time.
6005659.name: Elysium Spawn Tube

6005663.description: The Light Vehicle Terminal can be used to spawn small and medium sized ground vehicles at the cost of Cortium.
6005663.name: Light Vehicle Terminal

6005664.description: The Commando is built for utility in harsh environments and bears a deadly edge in close quarters combat.
6005664.name: NS-G Commando

6005666.description: Allows cortium to be used to create a module that, when powered, renders nearby structures nearly indestructible thanks to lightning-fast repairs. NC use only.
6005666.name: Repair Module

6005668.description: Allows cortium to be used to create a module that, when powered, applies automated targeting systems to nearby constructed turrets, allowing them fire upon enemies while unmanned. NC use only.
6005668.name: Turret AI Module

6005669.description: Allows cortium to be used to create a module that, when powered, applies one-way shields to structure openings to help protect the defenders inside. NC only.
6005669.name: Structure Shield Module

6005672.description: Allows cortium to be used to construct a module that, when powered, protects against aerial bombardment and infantry drops. Structures in range will gain resistance to orbital strike damage. NC only.
6005672.name: Skywall Shield Emitter

6005698.description: Constructs a large, fortified wall with firing areas for infantry.
6005698.name: Rampart Wall

6005700.description: Allows cortium to be used to create a garage suitable for protecting a deployed Sunderer. NC use only.
6005700.name: Sunderer Garage

6005701.description: Constructs a fortified bunker with firing areas for infantry.
6005701.name: Bunker

6005703.description: Allows cortium to be used to create a spire that, when powered, houses a spawnpoint Router. All Factions can use this item.
6005703.name: Routing Spire

6005706.description: Allows cortium to be used to create a spire that will damage enemy infantry and MAX within 15 meters of the spire. All Factions can use this item.
6005706.name: Pain Spire

6005713.description: Crafted in secret, this workshop item has a combat presence similar to the NS Baron G5. While the festive design is painted to resemble older weaponry with wooden pieces, the trees on Auraxis proved too difficult to use as raw material.
6005713.name: The Little Helper

6005743.description: This multi-purpose combat knife is built for winter environments, with a self-sharpening hardlight edge; built-in hand warmers; and a smaller, pommel-mounted blade for rope cutting and climbing.
6005743.name: NS-W Survivor

6005888.description: The Mandible mining laser harvests minerals from Cortium nodes at a steady pace, converting them into transportable material.
6005888.name: WLT-ARX Mining Laser

6005961.description: User deployable anti-vehicular mine, activated by nearby enemy vehicles.
6005961.name: Tank Mine

6005962.description: User deployable anti-vehicular mine, activated by nearby enemy vehicles.
6005962.name: Tank Mine

6005963.description: A deceptive looking land mine that, upon detecting nearby enemy infantry, explodes into a cloud of anti-infantry shrapnel.
6005963.name: Proximity Mine

6005966.description: Scrapped prior to release in favor of the Masamune's wire-guidance system and contextual firing modes, the NSX Muramasa can fire up to four accurate, high damage rockets either from the hip or while aiming down the optics.
6005966.name: NSX-A Muramasa

6005967.description: Unlike its Yumi predecessor, the NSX Kuwa will, after a short windup, release a torrent of accurate, high caliber rounds down range until the trigger is released. This weapon is a hybrid rifle, available to Engineer, Combat Medic, and Heavy Assault classes.
6005967.name: NSX-A Kuwa

6005968.description: A precursor to the Tengu SMG, the NSX Kappa spits out three heavy pellets per shot, and was the first SMG to integrate a smart choke system that tightens pellet spread while aiming down sights.
6005968.name: NSX-A Kappa

6005969.description: During focus group testing, the compact, automatic, NSX Yawara pistol was overlooked at nearly every turn, failing to reach the popularity of the numerous other Nanite Systems pistol designs released throughout the Auraxian War.
6005969.name: NSX-A Yawara

6005970.description: The NSX Sesshin was intended as a multi-class platform that filled an aggressive, mid-long range combat role, though it was eventually set aside as company resources shifted in favor of developing the Daimyo and Tomoe.
6005970.name: NSX-A Sesshin

6006063.description: The M202 Wyrm wing-mounted machine guns fire slow, high-damage rounds most effective against heavily armored land and air vehicles.
6006063.name: M202 Wyrm

6006064.description: The M202 Wyrm wing-mounted machine guns fire slow, high-damage rounds most effective against heavily armored land and air vehicles.
6006064.name: M202 Wyrm

6006065.description: The M202 Wyrm wing-mounted machine guns fire slow, high-damage rounds most effective against heavily armored land and air vehicles.
6006065.name: M202 Wyrm

6006067.description: This special, Auraxium variant of the Commando combat knife represents the operative's mastery at striking when least expected.
6006067.name: NS-A Commando

6006068.description: The Flail fires a volley of 4 mortar shells in quick succession, doing moderate damage to all in range. Requires AI module as well as a manually fired targeting dart in order to fire.
6006068.name: The Flail

6006069.description: The Glaive Ionized Particle Cannon is unmanned mid-range artillery that disrupts defensive shield systems but only inflicts minor damage to personnel and equipment due to its lack of conventional payload. The IPC requires AI module support as well as a manually fired targeting dart to acquire a target.
6006069.name: Glaive IPC

6006080.description: Despite the visible age of this ornate relic, the blade remains sharp to the touch. You feel that this dagger has taken many lives, possibly prior to the Auraxian war.
6006080.name: Fatestealer

6006081.description: This ornate blade hums with purpose, as if it has a hunger waiting to be satiated. The corrosive edge dissolves any metal it touches, but is somehow protected from devouring itself.
6006081.name: Nightshade

6006090.description: The Cerberus is able to fire overcharged rounds that are highly damaging in close range. VS use only.
6006090.name: "Jackpot" Cerberus

6006091.description: A popular sidearm amongst TR soldiers, the high-capacity TX2 Emperor has been in service for over 200 years. TR use only.
6006091.name: TX2 "Jackpot" Emperor

6006092.description: The 2-round burst LA3 Desperado can quickly eliminate targets at close range. NC use only.
6006092.name: LA3 "Jackpot" Desperado

6006146.description: The Campion has earned a sinister reputation on the battlefield after seeing extensive use by Stalker Infiltrators during its initial rollout.
6006146.name: NS Campion

6006147.description: The Campion has earned a sinister reputation on the battlefield after seeing extensive use by Stalker Infiltrators during its initial rollout.

6006850.description: The Advantix "Mako" Sniper Rifle embodies the long-distance stopping power of a traditional bolt-action while retaining versatility through a balanced reload speed and attachment variety. NSO use only.
6006850.name: ADVX // Mako

6007252.description:
Water balloons approved for both recreational and combat use.

Limited event item.
6007252.name: Water Balloon

6008371.description: The Diamondback assault rifle is a more aggressive take on the time-tested, and highly adaptable NS-11A.
6008371.name: PSA-02 Diamondback

6008496.description: The Hammerhead anti-materiel rifle revisits the power of the trusted NS-AM7 Archer, while bringing with it a more striking and modern visual design.
6008496.name: PSA-01 Hammerhead AMR

6008644.description: The Naginata light machine gun can maintain rounds on medium ranged targets without releasing the trigger, but quickly loses that benefit while moving. All factions can use NS weapons.
6008644.name: NSX "Ivory" Naginata

6008645.description: The Yumi burst rifle is capable of, after a short delay, unleashing a rapid five round volley. With proper shot placement, Yumi can strike down mid-range targets more quickly than most weapons in its class. All factions can use NS weapons.
6008645.name: NSX "Ivory" Yumi

6008651.description: These alien shards are held in place with a psykinetic link channeled through the gauntlet. This weapon was re-created from Briggs' original design, constructed after his mind-altering encounter with an ancient Vanu artifact.
6008651.name: Ancient Psykinetic Blade

6008652.description: Daimyo's three-round magazine contains the headshot killing potential of a bolt-action sniper rifle, with the follow-up potential usually found in semi-automatic snipers. All factions can use NS weapons.
6008652.name: NSX "Ivory" Daimyo

6008654.description: Focusing on high rate of fire and deadly precision, Tomoe rewards headhunters, making it a desirable option for mid-range assassinations. All factions can use NS weapons.
6008654.name: NSX "Ivory" Tomoe

6008660.description: The playful Tengu SMG scatters four pellets per shot, and narrows its pellet spread while aiming down sights. All factions can use NS weapons.

6008666.description: The fully automatic NS-61 Emissary operates comfortably at mid-range, thanks to its accuracy and large magazine. All factions can use this weapon.
6008666.name: NS-61 "Networked" Emissary

6008668.description: The Naginata light machine gun can maintain rounds on medium ranged targets without releasing the trigger, but quickly loses that benefit while moving. All factions can use NS weapons.

6008686.description: Wrist-mounted nano-printers replenish explosives periodically, and require cooldown when overheated.

6008733.description: The Nemesis Evaluation Seeking and Tracking system in these micro-missiles are fired in bursts and after traveling several meters can divert course mid-flight to home in on medium or larger sized vehicles they fly nearby. The payload in these projectiles are suited for general purpose anti-vehicle combat. NSO use only.

6009058.description: Deploys a dampening field that reduces common explosive damage by 50% for allied infantry and MAX units within range. Only one Ordnance Dampener can be active at a time.

6009064.name: Hardlight Canopy

6009069.description: Deploy a powerful cortium bomb that will explode after 20 seconds, doing high damage over a large radius. Detonation is cancelled if destroyed before the timer expires. Can only deploy outside.

6009090.description: Deploys a Caltrop tank trap that inhibits the movement of vehicles. Lasts 30 minutes or until destroyed. Up to four Caltrops can be active at a time.

6009093.description: This single-use Infradine injector will, allow the soldier to view heat signatures as if they were using an infrared scope. <font color="#dc9c36">Lasts up to 30 seconds.</font>

6009101.description: Heavy modification has reclassified this NS-30 Vandal as a "non-lethal rifle," capable of firing concussive smart-slugs that slow enemy infantry on impact. 6009426.description: This special edition variant of the Thumper heavy grenade launcher celebrates the PlanetSide franchise! It comes equipped with an anti-infantry fragmentation payload, and has access to multiple specialized munitions. All factions can use this weapon.
6009426.name: NS-03 Thumper SE

6009459.description:
When this sticky grenade is thrown during an Electrical Storm, it will create the conditions for a lightning strike at its location.

Has no effect when thrown outside of an Electrical Storm. Takes 6 seconds for a bolt to manifest.

This item expires at the end of the Campaign.
6009459.name: Lightning Grenade

6009460.description: Deploys a drone for the Metal Detector mission
6009460.name: Metal Detector

6009461.description: The Anaconda is a hybrid combat platform equipped with an anti-vehicle chaingun and havoc rocket launcher. The havoc rocket fires when aiming the weapon's optics. All factions can use this weapon.
6009461.name: L20 Anaconda

6009463.description: A keepsake from your exploration of the storm-ravaged Esamir, this frost-worn pick is the perfect tool to break the tension.
6009463.name: NS Icebreaker

6009464.description: This rack of anti-air missiles lock onto enemy aircraft, unleashing a barrage of four havoc warheads. On impact, mechanical targets will be affected by a destabilizing field that prevents them from being repaired for up to 6 seconds.
6009464.name: Havoc Missiles

6009465.description: This rack of anti-air missiles lock onto enemy aircraft, unleashing a barrage of four havoc warheads. On impact, mechanical targets will be affected by a destabilizing field that prevents them from being repaired for up to 6 seconds.

6009467.description: Deploy a device that will redirect and absorb nearby lightning strikes to itself. An absorbed bolt will not harm anything except the device itself. Only 1 Lightning Arrester can be active at a time.
6009467.name: Lightning Arrester

6009487.description:
This specialty device neutralizes the Tempest charge of derelict post-collapse vehicles, and can deplete the ability energy of enemy infantry.

Hold Fire to deplete energy.

This item expires at the end of the Campaign.
6009487.name: Neutralizer Device

6009490.description: The Anaconda is a hybrid combat platform equipped with an anti-vehicle chaingun and havoc rocket launcher. The havoc rocket fires when aiming the weapon's optics. All factions can use this weapon.
6009490.name: L20 Anaconda

6009492.description: The Anaconda is a hybrid combat platform equipped with an anti-vehicle chaingun and havoc rocket launcher. The havoc rocket fires when aiming the weapon's optics. All factions can use this weapon.
6009492.name: L20 Anaconda

6009515.description: A keepsake from your exploration of the storm-ravaged Esamir, this frost-worn pick is the perfect tool to break the tension.
6009515.name: NS Icebreaker

6009516.description: A keepsake from your exploration of the storm-ravaged Esamir, this frost-worn pick is the perfect tool to break the tension.
6009516.name: NS Icebreaker

6009517.name: NS Icebreaker

6009518.description: A keepsake from your exploration of the storm-ravaged Esamir, this frost-worn pick is the perfect tool to break the tension.
6009518.name: NS Icebreaker

6009524.description:
The Condensate Grenade detonates into an icy explosion that slows the movement, reload speed, and rate of fire of infantry and MAX units by 20% for up to 6 seconds. This item expires at the end of the Campaign.

3 second fuse.
6009524.name: Condensate Grenade

6009572.description: Coated in an advanced alloy that allows it to navigate harsh weather with ease, the Stormglider Drone was originally created by Nanite Systems to collect atmospheric readings on newly terraformed worlds.
6009572.name: Stormglider Drone

6009583.description:
Who knows how these nasty pumpkin-like grenades are made, all we can tell is that they explode into an unholy fire upon detonation. Destroying Space Pumpkins and Galact-O-Lanterns will restock these grenades.

Limited event item.
6009583.name: Infernal Grenade

6009600.description: Originally developed for exploration on Esamir as a companion tool to the NS Icebreaker, the Firebug has recently gained popularity among soldiers looking for a more dramatic option in close-quarters combat.
6009600.name: NS Firebug

6009604.description: Designed to remain operable in the vacuum of space, this assault rifle can easily engage targets at moderate range. All factions can use NS weapons.
6009604.name: NS-11 "Endeavor" Assault Rifle

6009605.description: This handheld version of the mining laser technology patented by Nascent Expeditions is primarily used to liquify crystalized ore, but can be used to ward off enemies in a pinch. All factions can use this weapon.
6009605.name: NE-11 PML

6009623.description: This compact personal defense weapon is a favorite among space-faring civilians and security details alike. All factions can use NS weapons.
6009623.name: NS-7 "Endeavor" PDW

6009652.description: There is no stun setting on this powerful photon sidearm, and is an intimidating asset both on-world and off. All factions can use NS weapons.
6009652.name: NS-357 "Endeavor" Underboss

6009656.description: This all-rounder carbine has proven its worth defending off-planet mining colonies. All factions can use NS weapons.
6009656.name: NS-11 "Endeavor" Carbine

6009672.description: With a high-capacity battery, this photon machinegun has proven to be an effective insurance policy during trade-route negotiations off-world. All factions can use NS weapons.
6009672.name: NS-15 "Endeavor" Machinegun

6009722.description: This unassuming three-round burst compact pistol carries surprising stopping power in close quarters. All factions can use NS weapons.
6009722.name: NS-45P Pilot

6009723.description:
Allies within 6m of the pylon have their maximum shield health increased by 50.

This item expires at the end of the Campaign.
6009723.name: Shield Matrix Pylon

6009753.description: While active, the Elysium Refinery with gather and process Elysium Crystals that are broken down within 75 meters of it.
6009753.name: Elysium Refinery

6009782.description:
The label on this gift-wrapped explosive reads, "WARNING: Contents are not candy and may detonate if eaten."

Use Aim to throw a brick of C-4 and hold Fire to detonate. Limited event item.
6009782.name: C-4 Present

6009835.description: The Spear Anti-Vehicle Phalanx Turret is capable of rapidly firing 120mm AP tank rounds capable of damaging heavily armored targets.
6009835.name: Spear Anti-Vehicle Phalanx Turret

6009854.description: This heavy blade is capable of light damage to armor, and represents the trials beyond Auraxis.
6009854.name: Excursion Kukri

6009856.description:
This scanner from Nanite Systems can be used to identify ideal locations to deploy relay devices. Includes several relays that amplify signals over short distances.

Use Fire to scan and use Aim to deploy.
6009856.name: Signal Scanner

6009864.description: This standard issue rifle was the genesis for all future experimentation into weapon design for field operatives. It harbors moderate rate of fire, stability, and stopping power, resulting in a versatile combat platform. NSO use only.
6009864.name: AR-100

6009866.description: Find fortune at the end of every trigger pull with this St. Patrick's Day themed NS Baron shotgun. This semi-auto powerhouse can put down targets at ranges beyond that of typical shotguns thanks to its narrow choke.
6009866.name: NS "Lucky" Baron G5

6009891.description: The AR-101 was quick to follow its predecessor's design, with modest modifications that include additional stopping power and controllability at cost to rate of fire. NSO use only.
6009891.name: AR-101

6009892.description: The semi-auto N203 assault rifle retains accuracy through a controlled, three-round burst, while offering stopping power that rivals that of heavier weapons. NSO use only.
6009892.name: AR-N203

6009893.description: The CB-100 was developed with versatility in mind, arming operatives with consistent damage and reliable recoil at close to mid range. NSO use only.
6009893.name: CB-100

6009894.description: The CB-X75 is an aggressive carbine built for close quarters combat. The X75 retains better hipfire accuracy than most carbines, and the lightweight design allows for better mobility while aiming down sights. NSO use only.
6009894.name: CB-X75

6009895.description: Big brother to the CB-100, the 200 model was designed to emphasize stopping power and accuracy at cost to its rate of fire. NSO use only.
6009895.name: CB-200

6009896.description: The incredibly popular PMG-100 became standard-issue after operatives lauded its high rate of fire, and the versatility afforded by its large magazine. NSO use only.
6009896.name: PMG-100

6009897.description: The PMG-200 opts for better per-bullet stopping power and snappy reloads, at cost to its magazine size. NSO use only.
6009897.name: PMG-200

6009898.description: The experimental 3XB offers an automatic three-round burst that drastically increases accuracy over distance, while maintaining the expected sting of an SMG. NSO use only.
6009898.name: PMG-3XB

6009899.description: The XMG-100's large magazine and high rate of fire solidifies its use during close-to-medium range assault scenarios. NSO use only.
6009899.name: XMG-100

6009900.description: Feedback from field operatives resulted in the release of the XMG-155 that houses a larger magazine and slightly more stopping power than its predecessor could afford. NSO use only.
6009900.name: XMG-155

6009901.description: The XMG-200's design was centered around increased effectiveness during open-field combat with as little downtime as possible. NSO use only.
6009901.name: XMG-200

6009902.description: The standard-issue U-100 Lastly is a reliable sidearm with moderate punch, stable recoil, and 12-round magazine. NSO use only.
6009902.name: U-100 Lastly

6009903.description: Code-named "Recall" after a famous field operative, the U-150 offers a large, 20-round magazine with a mid-range damage profile. NSO use only.
6009903.name: U-150 Recall

6009904.description: The U-200's high-impact rounds are capable of dropping opponents at close range with little notice, though its magazine size suffers in trade. NSO use only.
6009904.name: U-200 Harbinger

6009905.description: All heavy combat units are outfitted with a general purpose dumbfire rocket launcher to contest enemy vehicles as needed. NSO use only.
6009905.name: LAV-AG

6009906.description: The LAV-LG can lock onto ground vehicles to fire a homing missile, or be dumbfired when the situations calls for it. NSO use only.
6009906.name: LAV-LG

6009907.description: The LAV-LA can lock onto aircraft at moderate distances, allowing it to fire a homing missile. It may also be dumbfired without a lock when needed. NSO use only.
6009907.name: LAV-LA

6009908.description: Labeled a "heavy" shotgun, the slow-firing HSG-400 can down close-range infantry targets in a single shot. While magazine size is limited, the weapon still takes advantage of a standard mag-fed reload system. NSO use only.
6009908.name: HSG-400

6009909.description: What the fully-automatic A25 loses in range, it makes up for in rate of fire. NSO use only.
6009909.name: SG-A25

6009910.description: The standard-issue SG-100 has a large magazine size and excellent pellet coverage, making it a staple among operatives in CQB scenarios. NSO use only.
6009910.name: SG-100

6009928.description: After a short lock-on period, Photon A2A missiles can be fired which carry an explosive payload, melting the armor of heavy aircraft, while being less effective against smaller ones. VS use only.
6009928.name: DV-21 Lotus

6009971.description: The automatic SOAS-20's high rate of fire makes it an excellent choice for mid-range encounters. TR use only.
6009971.name: SOAS-20 "Hazmat"

6009972.description: The fully automatic Artemis VX26 scout rifle is capable of quickly dispatching enemy infantry at close to medium ranges. VS use only.
6009972.name: Artemis "Hazmat" VX26

6009973.description: The automatic AF-18 Stalker is deadly in close quarters and medium range combat. NC use only.
6009973.name: AF-18 "Hazmat" Stalker

6009974.description: Focusing on high rate of fire and deadly precision, Tomoe rewards headhunters, making it a desirable option for mid-range assassinations. All factions can use NS weapons.
6009974.name: NSX "Hazmat" Tomoe

6010.description:
The Nano-Armor Kit repairs friendly vehicles, MAXes, equipment and can deconstruct enemy tank mines.

Hold Fire to repair and Aim to deconstruct.
6010.name: Nano-Armor Kit 6

6121.description: G20 Vulcan-H fires armor piercing 20mm rounds capable of damaging heavily armored targets. TR use only.

6122.description: The P525 Marauder-H fires 40mm high explosive grenades that are effective against infantry and light armor. TR use only.

6123.description: The Enforcer ML85 fires magnetically propelled HEAT darts, suited for sustained damage in mid-range combat scenarios. NC use only.

6550.description: The M20 Wyvern has superior RPM and faster reload compared to other M20 heavy machine guns but at the cost of a smaller magazine. Like other M20 HMGs, its 20mm rounds are capable of damaging all targets. All factions can use this weapon.

6553.description: The CAS 14-E is designed to provide close air support using its 14mm explosive rounds and high magazine capacity to effectively eliminate hostile personnel. All factions can use this weapon.

6556.description: The Hellion G20 chain gun fires special armor piercing 20mm rounds that are effective against vehicles at close range. It takes 1.5 seconds for the G20 to spool up and reach full firing speed. All factions can use this weapon.

6559.description: The Pelter Rocket Pod launches a barrage of unguided anti-armor rockets which have little explosive yield. All factions can use this weapon.
6559.name: Pelter Rocket Pod

6562.description: The VLG fires a laser guided missile that seeks toward the gunner's crosshairs. The missile is effective against armor on direct hits and produces a moderate blast. Missile will detonate after traveling 400 meters. All factions can use this weapon.
6562.name: VLG Missile Launcher
