69999.description: The NS-11P is a platinum variant of the NS-11A.  Its large, rapid-reload magazine and high-velocity cartridges complement its variety of attachments. All factions can use NS weapons.
69999.name: NS-11P

7.description: A signal-emitting beacon that allows squad members to drop pod into an area from low orbit.
7.name: Spawn Beacon

700.description: The Aspis Phalanx Turret rapidly fires 20mm shells that create a burst of flak when within proximity of hostile aircraft.
700.name: Aspis Anti-Aircraft Phalanx Turret

701.description: The Aspis Phalanx Turret rapidly fires 20mm shells that create a burst of flak when within proximity of hostile aircraft.
701.name: Aspis Anti-Aircraft Phalanx Turret

702.description: The Aspis Phalanx Turret rapidly fires 20mm shells that create a burst of flak when within proximity of hostile aircraft.
702.name: Aspis Anti-Aircraft Phalanx Turret

703.description: The Spear Anti-Vehicle Phalanx Turret is capable of rapidly firing 120mm AP tank rounds capable of damaging heavily armored targets.
703.name: Spear Anti-Vehicle Phalanx Turret

704.description: The Spear Anti-Vehicle Phalanx Turret is capable of rapidly firing 120mm AP tank rounds capable of damaging heavily armored targets.
704.name: Spear Anti-Vehicle Phalanx Turret

705.description: The Spear Anti-Vehicle Phalanx Turret is capable of rapidly firing 120mm AP tank rounds capable of damaging heavily armored targets.
705.name: Spear Anti-Vehicle Phalanx Turret

70998.description: The 11A was designed as a highly adaptable weapons system that could be customized to nearly any situation. Its large, rapid-reload magazine and high-velocity cartridges complement its variety of attachments. All factions can use NS weapons.
70998.name: NS-11A

7101.description: The Gauss Rifle Burst features the same versatility as the NC1, but with an easily controllable burst fire mode. NC use only.
7101.name: Gauss Rifle Burst

7102.description: The Gauss Rifle S possesses a select fire option that allows for further adaptability on the battlefield. NC use only.
7102.name: Gauss Rifle S

7103.description: Designed in the late 28th century for close quarters and mid-range combat scenarios, the Carnage AR features high hip fire accuracy and an adaptable attachment system. NC use only.
7103.name: Carnage AR

7104.description: The NC's A-Tross was created as the ultimate in heavy-hitting, long-range assault rifles. Featuring a 30-round magazine and an overclocked propulsion coil firing a high-damage projectile, the A-Tross can drop targets at even distant ranges.
7104.name: NC9 A-Tross

7108.description: The powerful and accurate Reaper DMR was developed to fulfill the needs of soldiers who prefer to provide support from a distance. NC use only.
7108.name: Reaper DMR

7124.description: The Cycler TRV's fast rate of fire makes it extremely effective in close quarters, though that same rate of fire and high recoil limits its effectiveness at long range when firing in full-auto. TR use only.
7124.name: Cycler TRV

7125.description: The SABR-13's two-round burst fire mode was originally developed with ammunition conservation in mind. It has since become popular with marksmen because of its ability to reliably land those two rounds on target from long range. TR use only.
7125.name: SABR-13

7126.description: The versatile T1B Cycler is nearly identical to the original, with an added accurate burst fire mode. TR use only.
7126.name: T1B Cycler

7127.description: The T1S Cycler performs well at many ranges, attributing its adaptability due to its multiple fire modes. TR use only.
7127.name: T1S Cycler

7128.description: Many TR soldiers praise the Terran Assault Rifle's performance in the field, crediting many victories to its incredible hip fire accuracy and high rate of fire. TR use only.
7128.name: TAR

7129.description: The Terran Operations Rifle is a favorite amongst TR who feel at home with an all-around performer. Deadly accurate with fast reload assists for its 40 round magazine, the TORQ-9's versatility and ease of use make it a solid choice in combat.
7129.name: TORQ-9

7148.description: The H-V45 was created with a focus on close quarters mobility. Its light weight does not slow the shooter as much as most other weapons in its class. VS use only.
7148.name: H-V45

7149.description: The CME's high projectile velocity and good accuracy make it a very effective weapon at medium and long ranges. VS use only.
7149.name: CME

7150.description: Vanu Esamir Labs created the Equinox VE2 Burst to provide easily controllable burst fire for distant targets. VS use only.
7150.name: Equinox VE2 Burst

7151.description: The versatile Equinox VE2 assault rifle was designed to perform well in many situations. VS use only.
7151.name: Equinox VE2

7152.description: The Corvus VA55 features low recoil and high accuracy over sustained fire, making it a popular choice for long range engagements. VS use only.
7152.name: Corvus VA55

7153.description: The Vanu's shadowy VX Labs launched the Terminus VX-9 shortly after joining the war. Engineered with advanced cooling systems that allow for its high rate of fire, the Terminus allows users to hold their ground at close-to-medium ranges.
7153.name: Terminus VX-9

71563.description: Allows the engineer to construct a MANA anti-vehicle missile turret. The missile is laser guided and requires the operator to guide the missile to its target.
71563.name: Anti-Vehicle MANA Turret

71564.description: Allows the engineer to construct a MANA anti-vehicle missile turret. The missile is laser guided and requires the operator to guide the missile to its target.
71564.name: Anti-Vehicle MANA Turret

71565.description: Allows the engineer to construct a MANA anti-vehicle missile turret. The missile is laser guided and requires the operator to guide the missile to its target.
71565.name: Anti-Vehicle MANA Turret

7169.description: Genudine Dynamics' initial venture into carbines produced the GD-7F. Its high rate of fire makes it an effective weapon in close quarter combat situations. NC use only.
7169.name: GD-7F

7170.description: The powerful AC-X11 was released shortly before Auraxis' global war yet still remains in common use due to its famed reliability and high stopping power. NC use only.
7170.name: AC-X11

7171.description: The NC2B Gauss Compact features a burst fire mode for controllable long range fire. NC use only.
7171.name: Gauss Compact Burst

7172.description: The NC2S Gauss Compact possesses a select-fire mode that further diversifies the usage of the already adaptable carbine. NC use only.
7172.name: Gauss Compact S

7173.description: Genudine Dynamics unveiled the Razor GD-23 in the early 29th century. The Razor quickly became popular due to its high accuracy and controllable recoil, allowing it to outperform other carbines at long distances. NC use only.
7173.name: Razor GD-23

7174.description: Designed with mobility in mind, the lightweight alloys that make up Auraxis Firearm's AF-A4 Bandit allows for faster movement while aiming without compromising on stopping power in close to medium ranges.
7174.name: AF-4A Bandit

7190.description: The T5 AMC's damage output and controllable recoil was designed around giving Terran Republic soldiers increased effectiveness in medium range encounters. TR use only.
7190.name: T5 AMC

7191.description: The burst fire variant of the TRAC-5 provides accurate and controllable firepower suitable for any number of situations. TR use only.
7191.name: TRAC-5 Burst

7192.description: Created to further enhance the carbine's versatility, the TRAC-5 S can choose between multiple fire modes for firing at distant targets. TR use only.
7192.name: TRAC-5 S

7193.description: Boasting a longer barrel than its compact Light Carbine cousin, the mobile LC3 Jaguar was designed to provide accurate hip fire at longer distances than the Lynx. TR use only.
7193.name: LC3 Jaguar

7194.description: The Terran Republic's Heavy Carbine project resulted in the HC1 Cougar. Utilizing a higher caliber cartridge than its LC cousins, the Cougar possesses unparalleled stopping power amongst other Terran carbines up to medium range.
7194.name: HC1 Cougar

7211.description: Based off of its bigger assault rifle brother, the smaller Pulsar C  was developed with an emphasis on stopping power. While not as easy to control, the heavy-hitting Pulsar C is far more devastating at close range. VS use only.
7211.name: Pulsar C

7212.description: Vanu Esamir's weapon labs created the Solstice Burst to further extend the weapon's range with a controlled burst fire mode. VS use only.
7212.name: Solstice Burst

7213.description: A built-in select fire mode gives users of the Solstice SF the ability to adapt to nearly any scenario. VS use only.
7213.name: Solstice SF

7214.description: The Serpent VE92's overclocked power core interface allows for an extremely high rate of fire, making it a lethal opponent in close quarters combat. VS use only.
7214.name: Serpent VE92

7215.description: Vanu Labs' close-to-midrange Zenith VX-5 uses advanced crystalline structures to significantly reduce weight without compromising on strength. It features both precision hipfire and increased movement speed while aiming.
7215.name: Zenith VX-5

7232.description: Esamir Munition Corporation's EM1 LMG is a unique mix of high ammo count and fast reloading time, allowing the shooter to control firing lanes with little downtime. NC use only.
7232.name: EM1

7233.description: Genudine Dynamics developed the 22S as a possible replacement for the NC6 SAW. In comparison to the SAW, it features a faster firing rate and reload time, but is limited by a 50-round detachable box magazine. NC use only.
7233.name: GD-22S

7234.description: The NC6S Gauss SAW's select fire mode gives it incredible adaptability on the field. NC use only.
7234.name: NC6S Gauss SAW S

7235.description: The EM6's incredible adaptability on the field makes it popular among NC soldiers. NC use only.
7235.name: EM6

7236.description: The LA1 Anchor is tuned for close quarters effectiveness. It features high damage, moderate rate of fire, advanced laser attachments, and a 50 round box magazine for quick combat reloads. NC use only.
7236.name: LA1 Anchor

724.description: The Xiphos Anti-Personnel Phalanx Turret sprays 20mm rounds with its twin rotary guns that are damaging to infantry and light armor.
724.name: Xiphos Anti-Personnel Phalanx Turret

725.description: The Xiphos Anti-Personnel Phalanx Turret sprays 20mm rounds with its twin rotary guns that are damaging to infantry and light armor.
725.name: Xiphos Anti-Personnel Phalanx Turret

7253.description: This special, versatile variant of the CARV can adapt to nearly any situation thanks to its multiple firing modes and wide range of attachments. Compared to its predecessor, it features a slightly slower rate of fire and more controllable recoil. TR use only.
7253.name: T9 CARV-S

7254.description: The MSW-R was designed to meet the needs of mobile Terran Republic shock troopers. Its light weight and fast reload time allows forward soldiers to push forward without stopping. TR use only.
7254.name: MSW-R

7255.description: The T16 Rhino was designed as a squad support weapon that remains accurate, even during sustained fire. TR use only.
7255.name: T16 Rhino

7256.description: Designed with distance and accuracy in mind, the TMG-50's manageable recoil allows it to outperform other LMGs at long range. TR use only.
7256.name: TMG-50

7257.description: Developed for a mix of close quarters combat and point defense, the T32 Bull features both balanced recoil and high maneuverability. TR use only.
7257.name: T32 Bull

726.description: The Xiphos Anti-Personnel Phalanx Turret sprays 20mm rounds with its twin rotary guns that are damaging to infantry and light armor.
726.name: Xiphos Anti-Personnel Phalanx Turret

727.description: The Aspis Phalanx Turret rapidly fires 20mm shells that create a burst of flak when within proximity of hostile aircraft.
727.name: Aspis Anti-Aircraft Phalanx Turret

7274.description: Embedded recoil dampeners along the barrel of the Polaris allow it to remain accurate when firing from the hip. VS use only.
7274.name: VX29 Polaris

7275.description: The Pulsar Light Support Weapon (LSW) is a Pulsar variant with a high capacity battery and heavier barrel. Its reputation as a highly versatile weapon makes it a popular choice for missions where anything can happen. VS use only.
7275.name: Pulsar LSW

7276.description: The SVA-88's overclocked discharge coil allows it to fire plasma at a higher velocity than most weapons in its class. When firing at long distances, the user will need to lead targets much less than usual. VS use only.
7276.name: SVA-88

7277.description: Vanu Esamir's AdvWep labs designed the heavy-hitting Flare VE6 to pack the most punch per shot. In the hands of an experience marksman, the Flare can wreak havoc on enemy infantry at close to medium ranges. VS use only.
7277.name: Flare VE6

7278.description: The Ursa features manageable recoil and a high velocity projectile, making it extremely effective at ranges beyond that of other LMGs. VS use only.
7278.name: Ursa

73.description: The sleek, compact design of the GR-22 improves handling when firing on the move, making it an excellent choice for close quarters combat. NC use only.
73.name: GR-22

730.description: The Spear Anti-Vehicle Phalanx Turret is capable of rapidly firing 120mm AP tank rounds capable of damaging heavily armored targets.
730.name: Spear Anti-Vehicle Phalanx Turret

7301.description: Cutting edge railgun tech found in Auraxis' Firearms Railjack sniper rifle allows for lightning-fast bullet velocities. Distant targets are dropped almost instantly following a split-second charge-up delay from its powerful superconductor.
7301.name: AF-8 RailJack

7316.description: The TRAP-M1 can switch between short-range 3-round burst and long-range 2-round burst firing modes, allowing for incredible flexibility on the battlefield.
7316.name: TRAP-M1

7337.description: Equipped with an experimental regenerating power core, the Phaseshift VX-S has no use for traditional ammunition, and can switch between semi-auto and bolt-action firing modes to fit the engagement range. VS use only.
7337.name: Phaseshift VX-S

7358.description: The automatic AF-18 Stalker is deadly in close quarters and medium range combat. NC use only.
7358.name: AF-18 Stalker

7365.description: The automatic SOAS-20's high rate of fire makes it an excellent choice for mid-range encounters. TR use only.
7365.name: SOAS-20

7372.description: The fully automatic Artemis VX26 scout rifle is capable of quickly dispatching enemy infantry at close to medium ranges. VS use only.
7372.name: Artemis VX26

7379.description: The versatile standard-issue NC4 Mag-Shot was the first pistol to utilize Gauss technology. This variant features a unique gold plating.  NC use only.
7379.name: NC4-FB Mag-Shot

7388.description: The LA8 Rebel's high damage gives it a longer effective range when compared to most side arms. NC use only.
7388.name: LA8 Rebel

7389.description: The 2-round burst LA3 Desperado can quickly eliminate targets at close range. NC use only.
7389.name: LA3 Desperado

7390.description: The NC08 Mag-Scatter's powerful gauss-propelled shot shells and compact frame make it an excellent close-range sidearm.
7390.name: NC08 Mag-Scatter

7391.description: The reliable TX1 Repeater's 3-round burst fire mode provides considerable stopping power at close range. This variant features a unique gold plating.  TR use only.
7391.name: TX1-FB Repeater

7400.description: A popular sidearm amongst TR soldiers, the high-capacity TX2 Emperor has been in service for over 200 years. TR use only.
7400.name: TX2 Emperor

7401.description: The TS2 Inquisitor features an extended magazine capable of outlasting the enemy even in the most drawn out firefights. TR use only.
7401.name: TS2 Inquisitor

7402.description: The Terran Republic's Automatic Machine Pistol functions similarly to an SMG thanks to its lightning-fast, fully automatic fire.
7402.name: T4 AMP

7403.description: The Beamer VS3 is the standard sidearm for the Vanu Sovereignty. Its high rate of fire allows the user to eliminate nearby targets quickly. This variant features a unique gold plating.  VS use only.
7403.name: Beamer VS3-FB

7412.description: Designed as an all-purpose sidearm for VS soldiers, the Manticore SX40 is able to perform well in any situation. VS use only.
7412.name: Manticore SX40

7413.description: The Cerberus is able to fire overcharged rounds that are highly damaging in close range. VS use only.
7413.name: Cerberus

7414.description: Reverse-engineered from ancient Vanu tech, the Spiker makes use of a standard 2x burst, as well as an alternate firing mode which charges up an armor piercing blast.
7414.name: Spiker

7423.description: The iconic NC12 Sweeper shotgun features a high capacity magazine as well as considerable stopping power at close range. It excels in urban combat scenarios. NC use only.
7423.name: NC12 Sweeper

7432.description: The powerful TS4 Haymaker features a large magazine, allowing for sustained fire without needing to reload. TR use only.
7432.name: TS4 Haymaker

7441.description: The Thanatos VE70's lethality in close quarters makes it a frightening opponent in urban combat scenarios. VS use only.
7441.name: Thanatos VE70

7494.description: This hard hitting but slower firing SMG is used as an efficient personal defense weapon.  Made by Nanite Systems, the leading Auraxis firearms dealer. All factions can use NS weapons.
7494.name: NS-7 PDW

7495.description: This hard hitting but slower firing SMG is used as an efficient personal defense weapon with a sleek black finish.  Made by Nanite Systems, the leading Auraxis firearms dealer. All factions can use NS weapons.
7495.name: NS-7B PDW

7496.description: This hard hitting but slower firing SMG is used as an efficient personal defense weapon with a solid gold finish.  Made by Nanite Systems, the leading Auraxis firearms dealer. All factions can use NS weapons.
7496.name: NS-7G PDW

75005.description: Modeled after the popular 11A, the 11C carbine is a stable and accurate all-arounder, making it a great choice for engagements up to medium ranges. All factions can use NS weapons.
75005.name: NS-11C

75034.description: Built off of the NS-11, the NS-15M1 is an accurate, magazine-fed LMG that performs well in most combat situations. The M1 was accidentally manufactured with a deep black paint, making it somewhat of a collectors item on Auraxis.
75034.name: NS-15M1

7505.description: The AF-34 Mattock features increased effective range in comparison to the other MAX anti-infantry weapons. NC use only.
7505.name: AF-34 Mattock

7506.description: Known for its lethality in close quarters, the automatic AF-41 Hacksaw's high rate of fire gives it an advantage for point defense scenarios. NC use only.
7506.name: AF-41 Hacksaw

75063.description: The awe-inspiring stopping power of the accurate NS-44 Commissioner revolver can put down even mid-range targets with a few well-placed shots. All factions can use this weapon.
75063.name: NS-44 Commissioner

7507.description: Auraxis Firearms' first venture into MAX weaponry was the AF-23 Grinder. It features an extended ammo reserve for sustained fire. NC use only.
7507.name: AF-23 Grinder

75071.description: Chambered for the powerful .357 magnum cartridge, the snub-nosed Underboss revolver features a faster rate of fire and more controllable recoil than its bigger NS-44 brother. All factions can use this weapon.
75071.name: NS-357 Underboss

75083.description: Nanite Systems' first attempts into close-range weaponry resulted in the powerful Baron G5. The tube fed Baron is able to put down targets at longer ranges than typical shotguns thanks to its narrow choke.
75083.name: NS Baron G5

7512.description: The M6 Onslaught was designed as a defensive alternative to the MX1, allowing for a higher rate of fire suitable for holding down important locations. TR use only.
7512.name: M6 Onslaught

7513.description: The M2's increased ammo capacity has proven itself as a boon to small or stranded squads. TR use only.
7513.name: M2 Mutilator

75170.description: The awe-inspiring stopping power of the accurate NS-44 Commissioner revolver can put down even mid-range targets with a few well-placed shots. All factions can use this weapon.
75170.name: NS-44G Commissioner

75171.description: Chambered for the powerful .357 magnum cartridge, the snub-nosed Underboss revolver features a faster rate of fire and more controllable recoil than its bigger NS-44 brother. All factions can use this weapon.
75171.name: NS-357G Underboss

75172.description: The awe-inspiring stopping power of the accurate NS-44 Commissioner revolver can put down even mid-range targets with a few well-placed shots. All factions can use this weapon.
75172.name: NS-44B Commissioner

75173.description: Chambered for the powerful .357 magnum cartridge, the snub-nosed Underboss revolver features a faster rate of fire and more controllable recoil than its bigger NS-44 brother. All factions can use this weapon.
75173.name: NS-357B Underboss

7518.description: Ironically nicknamed "Mercy," the latest iteration of the accurate Mobile Rotary Cannon can drop enemy infantry at a distance. TR use only.
7518.name: MRC3 Mercy

7519.description: The Nebula VM20's overclocked power core interface allows for a rapid rate of fire to quickly dispatch enemy infantry in close quarters. VS use only.
7519.name: Nebula VM20

7520.description: A late successor to the Quasar VM1, the Cosmos uses experimental plasma containment technology, resulting in larger rounds. These large plasma rounds cause less cranial trauma, but are significantly easier to strike mobile targets with. VS use only.
7520.name: Cosmos VM3

75234.description: The NS-11CP's compact frame makes it a viable close range option over its predecessor, the NS-11P, and just as effective as the original NS-11C.  All factions can use NS weapons.
75234.name: NS-11CP

7525.description: The lightweight Blueshift VM5 anti-infantry MAX weapon was designed to provide increased accuracy over the standard-issue VM1. VS use only.
7525.name: Blueshift VM5

75268.description: This platinum variant of the snub-nosed Underboss revolver features a faster rate of fire and more controllable recoil than the bigger NS-44 Commissioner.  All factions can use NS weapons.
75268.name: NS-357P Underboss

7528.description: The NC05 Jackhammer's stopping power and sustained fire capabilities make it a frightening weapon in close quarters combat. It features a unique burst fire mode that doubles its rate of fire. NC use only.
7528.name: NC05 Jackhammer

75285.description: While deployed, shares the locations of enemy infantry within 30 meters every 1.5 seconds; the Infiltrator also receives live movement updates of enemies within 20 meters. Lasts 120 seconds, two can be carried.
75285.name: Motion Spotter 1

75286.description: While deployed, shares the locations of enemy infantry within 35 meters every 1.5 seconds; the Infiltrator also receives live movement updates of enemies within 20 meters. Lasts 120 seconds, three can be carried.
75286.name: Motion Spotter 2

75287.description: While deployed, shares the locations of enemy infantry within 40 meters every 1.5 seconds; the Infiltrator also receives live movement updates of enemies within 20 meters. Lasts 180 seconds, three can be carried.
75287.name: Motion Spotter 3

75288.description: While deployed, shares the locations of enemy infantry within 45 meters every 1.5 seconds; the Infiltrator also receives live movement updates of enemies within 20 meters. Lasts 180 seconds, four can be carried.
75288.name: Motion Spotter 4

75289.description: While deployed, shares the locations of enemy infantry within 50 meters every 1.5 seconds; the Infiltrator also receives live movement updates of enemies within 20 meters. Lasts 240 seconds, five can be carried.
75289.name: Motion Spotter 5

7533.description: The sound of the menacing T7 MCG firing strikes fear into the heart of its enemies. It is capable of sustained fire that can tear apart entire squads. TR use only.
7533.name: T7 Mini-Chaingun

7540.description: The experimental Lasher X2 fires volatile orbs of plasma that explode on contact with hard surfaces. Field trials have demonstrated its effectiveness at suppressing fire, flushing out enemies and melting infantry. VS use only.
7540.name: Lasher X2

75490.description: The NS Patriot Flare Gun fires flares of all shapes and colors. All factions can use this weapon.
75490.name: NS Patriot Flare Gun

75517.description: The NC Patriot Flare Gun fires a variety of blue flares. NC use only
75517.name: NC Patriot Flare Gun

75519.description: The TR Patriot Flare Gun fires a variety of red flares. TR use only.
75519.name: TR Patriot Flare Gun

75521.description: The VS Patriot Flare Gun fires a variety of purple flares. VS use only.
75521.name: VS Patriot Flare Gun

7609.description: This single-use Restoration Kit regenerates 70 health per second for 12 seconds through needle-free, subcutaneous delivery of adrenaline and nanite-based coagulants.
7609.name: Restoration Kit

7610.description: This single-use Restoration Kit regenerates 70 health per second for 12 seconds through needle-free, subcutaneous delivery of adrenaline and nanite-based coagulants.
7610.name: Restoration Kit

7611.description: This single-use Restoration Kit regenerates 70 health per second for 12 seconds through needle-free, subcutaneous delivery of adrenaline and nanite-based coagulants.
7611.name: Restoration Kit

76358.description: The NS Deep Freeze is an experimental pistol that is capable of condensing and freezing atmospheric moisture then firing it as a projectile.
76358.name: NS Deep Freeze

7755.description:
Upon detonation, the Flash Grenade will temporarily blind, deafen, and reduce the accuracy of infantry within its blast radius, making it perfect for breaching crowded rooms.

3 second fuse.
7755.name: Flash Grenade

77822.description: Released as a commemorative edition of the NC's wildly successful foray into electromagnetic weaponry, the NC1 Gauss Rifle, the Gauss Prime marksman assault rifle can effortlessly drop distant targets.
77822.name: Gauss Prime

78.description: The NC6 Gauss SAW's low production cost, reliability, and sheer stopping power lead to wide-spread adoption of the weapon in the Auraxian War's early years. NC use only.
78.name: NC6 Gauss SAW

79.description: Aptly named, the  T9 CARV's rate of fire allows it to cut through whole groups of enemies before needing to reload. TR use only.
79.name: T9 CARV

80.description: The Orion VS54 is the standard issue LMG for Vanu Heavy Assault soldiers. Its lightweight construction allows for more accurate hip fire and stability when on the move when compared to most weapons in its class. VS use only.
80.name: Orion VS54

800623.description:
Special Auraxium-plated plastic explosives capable of incredible damage to both infantry, MAXes, and vehicles.

Use Aim to throw a brick of C-4 and hold Fire to detonate.
800623.name: C-4 ARX

800624.description: The Auraxium Mag-Cutter is only awarded to highly decorated New Conglomerate soldiers. It comes equipped with a powerful electromagnet that greatly enhances its cutting ability, allowing it to slice through heavy body armor.
800624.name: Auraxium Mag-Cutter

800625.description: Legal possession of an Auraxium Chainblade is considered a badge of honor amongst the Terran Republic.  Only the most revered TR soldiers will ever wield this powerful and highly desired miniature chainsaw.
800625.name: Auraxium Chainblade

800626.description: The mark of a highly regarded soldier, the Vanu Sovereignty only offers the Auraxium Force Blade to their most capable warriors. Much like its standard-issue version, contact with the blade is incredibly damaging to human tissues.
800626.name: Auraxium Force-Blade

800627.description: Nanite Systems' switch-style AutoBlade was launched as a full-featured utility knife. Its oscillating motor slices through tough materials with ease, while the integrated Lumifiber strips provide enough light for cutting wires in the dark.
800627.name: NS AutoBlade

801969.description: Simple stainless steel knives haven't gone out of style as a weapon of choice for the discerning space psycho. Despite using millenia-old technology, contemporary body armor hasn't solved the problem of 'getting stabbed.'
801969.name: The Slasher

801970.description: Originally designed as an office toy for long-range candy corn deliveries, Nanite Systems' Indar office branch quickly went out of business after the public experienced firsthand the folly of firing the world's hardest substance out of a 'toy' gun.
801970.name: NS CandyCannon 3000

802025.description: For the dedicated knife-wielding psycho, access to the hypnotically-shifting Auraxium Slasher is mysteriously granted after demonstrating a disturbing devotion to their craft.
802025.name: Auraxium Slasher

802099.description: The 11AB was designed as a customizable weapon system that could adapt to nearly every situation. This variant of the 11A features a sleek black finish. All factions can use NS weapons.
802099.name: NS-11AB

802100.description: A popular choice among Engineers and Light Assaults, the NS-11CB is an accurate and stable all-around performer. This variant of the 11C has a black metal finish. All factions can use NS weapons.
802100.name: NS-11CB

802101.description: The 11AG is the gold high-end variant of the adaptable 11A assault rifle platform. Reliable with a wide assortment of attachments, the 11AG can change itself to excel in nearly any situation. All factions can use NS weapons.
802101.name: NS-11AG

802102.description: The opulent NS-11CG is a variant of the 11C, a carbine well known for its stability and all-around performance. The 11CG is also known for all that, as well as looking good. All factions can use NS weapons.
802102.name: NS-11CG

802104.description: The gold finish on the NS-15MG has cemented it as a status symbol among soldiers on Auraxis. Good looks aside, the 15MG is an accurate all-arounder that performs well in many combat situations. All factions can use NS weapons.
802104.name: NS-15MG

802105.description: Created with a black metal finish, the imposing NS-15MB has accurate, stable fire at even long distances and reloads quickly. Its reputation as an all-arounder has made it a popular Heavy Assault choice. All factions can use NS weapons.
802105.name: NS-15MB

802106.description: Built off of the NS-11, the NS-15M2 is an accurate, magazine-fed LMG that leaves little downtime during reloads. Its reputation as a reliable all-arounder makes it suitable for many types of combat situations. All factions can use NS weapons.
802106.name: NS-15M2

802299.description: Designed for raw power, this gold plated variant of the Decimator is unmatched in its destructive potential against enemy vehicles and infantry. All factions can use NS weapons.
802299.name: NS Decimator-G

802300.description: Designed for raw power, this black variant of the Decimator is unmatched in its destructive potential against enemy vehicles and infantry. All factions can use NS weapons.
802300.name: NS Decimator-B

802301.description: Nanite Systems' Annihilator was the first rocket launcher to integrate both air and ground-based lockon capabilities, at cost to its dumbfire capabilities. This variant of the weapon sports a classy gold plating. All factions can use NS weapons. <font color="#dc9c36">Flak detonation. Required Lockon: Aircraft or Armor</font>
802301.name: NS Annihilator-G

802302.description: Nanite Systems' Annihilator was the first rocket launcher to integrate both air and ground-based lockon capabilities, at cost to its dumbfire capabilities. This variant of the weapon sports a sleek black finish. All factions can use NS weapons. <font color="#dc9c36">Flak detonation. Required Lockon: Aircraft or Armor</font>
802302.name: NS Annihilator-B

802315.description: Reverse engineered thanks to the Terran Republic's robust intelligence agency, the razor-sharp Hexedge knife is no less deadly than the stolen Vanu prototypes it's based off of.
802315.name: Hexedge

802316.description: The New Conglomerate's holographic Hardlight Dagger continually maintains the blade to keep itself sharp. Tapering down to only a few molecules at the edge of the blade, it can cut through body armor with ease.
802316.name: Hardlight Dagger

802317.description: Continually regenerating its cutting edge thanks to an embedded nanoconstructor, the Damascus Edge's patterned blade and cutting ability are thanks to a molecular structure similar to the legendary steel of the same name.
802317.name: Damascus Edge

802319.description: The NS-15M AE is an accurate, magazine-fed LMG that leaves little downtime during reloads. This commemorative edition of the popular all-arounder LMG features an exclusive orange stripe paintjob. All factions can use NS weapons.
802319.name: NS-15M AE

802322.description: Nanite Systems' launched the tube-fed Baron G5 shotgun to help round out their extensive arsenal. Decked out with a special orange stripe paintjob, the Baron G5AE performs well at ranges typical shotguns become ineffective. All factions can use NS weapons.
802322.name: NS Baron G5AE

802512.description:
Deploys a Spitfire Auto-Turret that automatically engages hostile infantry within 50 meters. Only one spitfire can be active at a time.

35 second cooldown.
802512.name: Spitfire Auto-Turret

802514.description: The Spitfire Auto-Turret is a deployable that automatically fires at hostile infantry within 50 meters.
802514.name: Spitfire Auto-Turret

802515.description:
Deploys a Spitfire Auto-Turret that automatically engages hostile infantry within 50 meters. Only one spitfire can be active at a time.

35 second cooldown.
802515.name: Spitfire Auto-Turret

802516.description:
Deploys a Spitfire Auto-Turret that automatically engages hostile infantry within 50 meters. Only one spitfire can be active at a time.

35 second cooldown.
802516.name: Spitfire Auto-Turret

802517.description: The Spitfire Auto-Turret is a deployable that automatically fires at hostile infantry within 50 meters.
802517.name: Spitfire Auto-Turret

802518.description: The Spitfire Auto-Turret is a deployable that automatically fires at hostile infantry within 50 meters.
802518.name: Spitfire Auto-Turret

802584.description: Though no doubt a top candidate for Auraxis' most unconventional weapon, the supercooled crystalline Icikill knife will chill both spines and nearby organs after coming in contact with them.
802584.name: Icikill

802733.description: With an extended barrel and integrated scope the NS-44L Blackhand provides significant advantages over similar pistols when engaging threats at longer ranges.
802733.name: NS-44L Blackhand

802738.description: The SVA-GG's overclocked discharge coil allows it to fire plasma at a higher velocity than most weapons in its class. When firing at long distances, the user will need to lead targets much less than usual. VS use only.
802738.name: SVA-GG

802768.description:
The Rocklet Rifle fires munitions that auto-det on aircraft or pierce enemy ground vehicle armor. Alternate rocklet types may be loaded into the weapon.

Press Aim Down Sights to fire a rocklet barrage.
802768.name: Rocklet Rifle

802771.description: The Archer anti-materiel rifle was developed by Nanite Systems to counter the heavily armored MAX, providing an effective option at range for dealing with the unique threat of the exo-suits.
802771.name: NS-AM7 Archer

802781.description: With an extended barrel and integrated scope the NS-44L Blackhand provides significant advantages over similar pistols when engaging threats at longer ranges.

804138.description: The fully automatic NS-61 Emissary operates comfortably at mid-range, thanks to its accuracy and large magazine. All factions can use this weapon.
804138.name: NS-61 Emissary

804179.description: Masamune integrates contextual firemodes, allowing it to release all four rockets from the hip, or laser guide them in a burst while using the cutting edge tracking optics. All players can use NS weapons.
804179.name: NSX Masamune

804243.description: The NSX Tanto is a powerful, lightweight carbine which combines precision with versatility, and is most effective in short bursts. All factions can use NS weapons.
804243.name: NSX Tanto

804246.description: The Yumi burst rifle is capable of, after a short delay, unleashing a rapid five round volley. With proper shot placement, Yumi can strike down mid-range targets more quickly than most weapons in its class. All factions can use NS weapons.
804246.name: NSX Yumi

804249.description: The Naginata light machine gun can maintain rounds on medium ranged targets without releasing the trigger, but quickly loses that benefit while moving. All factions can use NS weapons.
804249.name: NSX Naginata

804252.description: Focusing on high rate of fire and deadly precision, Tomoe rewards headhunters, making it a desirable option for mid-range assassinations. All factions can use NS weapons.
804252.name: NSX Tomoe

804255.description: Daimyo's three-round magazine contains the headshot killing potential of a bolt-action sniper rifle, with the follow-up potential usually found in semi-automatic snipers. All factions can use NS weapons.
804255.name: NSX Daimyo

804257.description: The playful Tengu SMG scatters four pellets per shot, and narrows its pellet spread while aiming down sights. All factions can use NS weapons.
804257.name: NSX Tengu

804263.description: Allows cortium to be used to construct a module that, when powered, protects against aerial bombardment and infantry drops. Structures in range will gain resistance to orbital strike damage. NC only.
